metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2861 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
[9pfs: prevent opening special files]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-block-extra - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-guest-agent - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-arm - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-common - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-data - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-gui - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-mips - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-misc - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-ppc - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-s390x - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-sparc - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-x86 - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-user - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-user-static - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
qemu-utils - 1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu6.16').
